intro: Sebastiania hispida f. glabrescens, commonly known as the smooth-sepal sebastiania, is a flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is characterized by its smooth, glabrous sepals, which distinguish it from other forms of Sebastiania hispida. The plant typically has small, clustered yellow flowers and is native to parts of Central and South America. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in horticulture and botanical studies.
